text: The Cairns Historical Society was founded in 1958 to record and preserve the history of North Queensland, Australia. It was formed under the sponsorship of the Cairns School of Arts and is located in the School of Arts Building, which also houses the Cairns Museum.Stone axe sparks historical interests, The Cairns Post 100 years of history, Dec 22, 1999, page 6 In 2014, it moved into temporary premises while the School of Arts Building undergoes a renovation.School of Arts building in line for upgrade, The Cairns Post, July 25, 2012, page 7, by Liam Parsons. As of 2014 it has 3,100 books, 23,000 photographs, 2,250 maps and 25,000 documents on local and area history.Cairns Museum, Cairns Historical Society, http://www.cairnsmuseum.org.au/index.php?option=com_content&task;=view&id;=20&Itemid;=48 ==References== Category:Historical societies of Australia Category:1958 establishments in Australia Category:Organizations established in 1958 Category:North Queensland Category:Organisations based in Queensland Category:Cairns, Queensland
title: Cairns Historical Society
